subject: Marketing
title: The Inverted Pyramid
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Inverted Pyramid.

hook.text: Journalists put the most important information first. The best copywriters do too.

buildup.text: The inverted pyramid leads with the key message, then adds supporting details.

discovery.text: Online readers scan from top to bottom. If the good stuff is buried, they never find it.

twist.text: Most business writing buries the point under context and backstory. Readers leave before finding it.

climax.text: Lead with the benefit. Follow with proof. Close with action. Never reverse this order.

punchline.text: Say the important thing first, not last.

quiz.question: What does the inverted pyramid structure require?
options: Leading with the most important information first
Saving the key message for the conclusion
Using equal emphasis on every paragraph
